text:
A simple supper is pretty hard to come
by but one of my absolute favorites is

these beautiful little Asian steam baked
mackerel parcels, very, very simple to make
and totally delicious

Now to start off, i have some chilli
ginger and garlic which I've finely chopped
and to that I'll make a little marinade

with some soy sauce and make sure to
use light soy sauce here. If you use dark soy sauce

it's really thick and dark and
quite overpowering whereas this light

soy sauce is perfect in here so good few
tablespoons in.
Then on top of that to cut through that we need a bit of acidity

I'm going to use some chinese rice wine, you can
get this in most asian supermarkets

It's really, really strong and very delicious
so a few tablespoons
should do us nicely.
Just mix that through with about a tablespoon of oil

I'm using rapeseed oil here, but you
could use sunflower or olive oil.
It's up to you, it's no big deal
so just mix that through

Essentially, that's our little marinade for the
steam baked parcels. Right now we need to
talk veggies. I've got spring onions and pak choi. I'm going to cut them up.
Right, my veggies are chopped. Now we need form our little parcels so you can use any fish
here, I'm going to use mackerel
I love mackerel, it's very easy to get where I love.
So what I'm going to do now is parcel up these little mackerel fillets.
So take a bit of parchment paper
Knife straight down the ways
and then a good generous amount of veggies in
some spring onions
all the way over there
Grab your mackerel fillet straight on top

and now once you've got the contents of
your little parcel made up what you need to
do
is
spoon over that little marinade we made up. So just a generous amount all the
way over

Now it's the liquid here that's going to
create
wonderful steam in here and allow these mackerel fillets to cook up.
So, now this is where
your Blue Peter skills need to come in
What you need to do is wrap this up, so parcel
Lay one side over like that

make sure all those little edges are in
there
Fold it on up.
You don't need it
one of my
greatest little tips here is to use

a little paper trip like this and it will just
make sure no steam escapes and that the
mackerel is left totally beautiful
So now, this goes into an oven at about two hundred degrees celsius
or four hundred degrees fahrenheit
for about ten to fifteen minutes until your mackerel is cooked served with some rice
noodles. It is delicious so I am just going to throw it into the oven here.
Now my fish has been in the oven, it's cooked, it's puffed up

and now all I'm going to do is serve it on a
chopping board like this
and I'm going to break it open to let the beautiful steam out. This is like the magic moment in this dish
Look at that, beautiful colours,

beautiful flavors and something that
I seriously want to dig in and

try, then just nozzle in alongside that
mackerel, I just have some rice noodles
just toss them in that lovely juice and in and around the side of it.

A delicious Asian mackerel steam baked
parcel doesn't get better than that and
try it at home. So delicious!
